data.description: Advanced level drawing course taught in a structured format where students work on various problems/issues in drawing.
data.title: ADVANCED DRAWING I

data.description: Apply the elements of drawing to more exploratory drawing methods and explore a wide variety of drawing concepts and applications in the context of Modern and Contemporary Art. Provides foundational skillsets for drawing and painting, printmaking and book art.
data.title: DRAWING FOUNDATIONS

data.description: Introduction to basic drawing. Core elements of drawing such as the use of line, shape, composition, space, perspective, value, and texture. Provides foundational skillsets for drawing.
data.title: DRAWING FOR NON-ART MAJORS

data.description: Seek answers to the fundamental question "What is art?" from multiple perspectives such as historical, theoretical, critical, conceptual, formal, and experiential. Develop visual literacy, sophisticated observational skills and a formal language to assist in the interpretation of objects and experiences in the context of art. Through both theory and practice, develop an understanding of the ways artists arrive at the ideas that inform their creative processes. Includes a survey of developments in art media and looks broadly at art movements, trends and styles throughout history and in varied world cultures.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO ART

data.description: The exploration of conceptual drawing in various media. Emphasis on conceptual/formal solutions.
data.title: INTERMEDIATE DRAWING I
